citations.narrative:
There was no emergency contingency plan written or available during the inspection.
A contingency plan allows for immediate contact information for responsible people and/or organizations that can assist
the facility during an emergency. This would include emergency protocols and proceedures to be followed in any
emergency situation a facility could experience.
The contingency plan should be made available during an inspection and on site for work personnel to include situations
the licensee might experience that would trigger the need for the measures identified in a contingency plan to be put into
action including, but not limited to, emergencies such as electrical outages, faulty HVAC systems, fires, mechanical
breakdowns, and animal escapes, as well as natural disasters most likely to be experienced;as well as
guidelines/locations for safe holding of the regulated animals in case of a tornado, fire or enclosure damage.
To be corrected by: April 20, 2024

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
Currently, there is no written enrichment plan approved by the attending veterinarian for the turkeys, chickens, peacocks
or duck at the facility where the birds are exhibited.
A written enrichment plan allows for the birds at the facility to be provided with proper socialization groups, environmental
enhancement options with speical considerations for nestlings/fledglings and chicks and how to decrease boredom and
psychological stress.
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. This plan must be made
available to APHIS upon request.
To be corrected by: April 25, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
